page.title: 03REFUSE DISPOSAL IN NETTLETON
page.content: Until recently Nettleton was an ironstone mining area and still has sand and chalk quarries,some of which are now exhausted.These deserted mines and quarries provide sites which can be used for refuse tips.In 1977 Lincs. C.C. established a tip at Woods Hill in O.S.square 05100399.The tip is used mainly for household refuse.Recently Broadcount Properties Ltd. have applied for permission to establish a tip in an old chalk quarry at Nettleton Bottom,O.S.square 05120398 which they wish to infill.They will dump category A and B rubbish which they say will not be a hazard.Local feeling runs high on this proposal. C.F. page 4,{PROTEST IN NETTLETON
